channel.title: SummonNPC();?
channel.description: I heard on msn theres a void that makes an npc(like NewNPC)but when its created it attacks whoever executed the code. Like for example, someone goes into fight caves and my code for entering fight caves summons an NPC, and it begins to attack you. Anyone have a void like this?

item.title: SummonNPC();?
item.dc:creator: @n0va_k0 n0va k0
item.description:
@n0va_k0 wrote:

I never did use any of his tuts yet :\ I used the SummonNewNPC method and made them aggressive through npc handler. I’ve had that since the first torso minigame came out with the desert top :l

Read full topic

item.title: SummonNPC();?
item.dc:creator: @dd1 dd
item.description:
@dd1 wrote:

So if you used LeScape’s tut on agressive NPCs and NewNpc they wouldn’t auto attack?

Read full topic

item.title: SummonNPC();?
item.dc:creator: @BurnInSilence BurnInSilence
item.description:
@BurnInSilence wrote:

I heard on msn theres a void that makes an npc(like NewNPC)but when its created it attacks whoever executed the code.
Like for example, someone goes into fight caves and my code for entering fight caves summons an NPC, and it begins to attack you.
Anyone have a void like this?

Read full topic
